API Reference
=============

.. py:class:: class WebDriver(self):

This is called by ``FanGraphs`` in ``__init__`` to create the ``self.webdriver`` attribute.
The attribute ``self.options`` holds the options returned when calling ``selenium.webdriver.firefox.options``.
The defaults in ``self.options`` are listed below:

	* ``self.options.headless``: ``True``
	* ``self.options.preferences``: 

		* ``"browser.download.folderList"``: 2
		* ``"browser.download.manager.showWhenStarting"``: ``False``
		* ``"browser.download.dir"``: ``os.getcwd()``
		* ``"browser.helperApps.neverAsk.saveToDisk"``: ``"text/csv"``

.. py:class:: class FanGraphs(self, *, setting)

Below are the compatible FanGraphs pages with the corresponding ``setting`` argument:
	
	* `Major League Leaderboards`_: ``"leaders"``
	* `Projections`_: ``"projections"``
	
	.. _Major League Leaderboards: https://fangraphs.com/leaders.aspx
	.. _Projections: https://fangraphs.com/projections.aspx

Passing an invalid argument to ``setting`` will result in ``fgexporter.InvalidSettingError`` being raised.

	.. py:method:: get_options(self, category)
	
	.. py:method:: get_current(self, category)
	
	.. py:method:: config(self, **kwargs)
	
	While multiple configurations can be passed, it is highly recommended that only one be passed at a time.
	Certain category configurations block the configurations of other categories.
	
	e.g. When 'leaders' is passed to as the ``setting`` argument, configuring **HOF** to `True` prevents configuring **Rookies** to ``True`` at the same time.
	
	For this reason, it is best practice to configure one category at a time, while using `FanGraphs.get_current` in between.
	
	.. py:method:: reset(self)
	
	.. py:method:: location(self)
	
	Returns the ``current_url`` attribute of ``FanGraphs.browser``.
	This is the equivalent of using ``FanGraphs.browser.current_url``
	
	.. py:method:: end_task(self)
	
	Calls the ``quit`` method of ``FanGraphs.browser``.
	This is the equivalent of calling ``FanGraphs.browser.quit()``
